subject: Re: Not another one-- for crying out loud!!
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Hi Bill (Willy),

Very nice radio!  Expensive..??? Well, I guess that depends.  You can 
get a nice used IC R-75 for about the same price or less than a... 
ahh... "Mini Box"(sorry April, Ron, Rick, nothing implied there 
except a price camparison)...
That Icom R-75 would be a sweet addition to a ham shack or paranormal 
shack.. :-)  sitting right next to a Franks Box, Mini Box, Joe's Box, 
and a couple of Radio Shack Hack's...

- Mike


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "billliscomb" <williscomb@...> wrote:
>
> Just dug out the manual for the Icom R-75 shortwave receiver that 
has 
> been in box for 2 years since I moved.  It has programable scan 
start 
> and stop frequencies, and variable scan steps and speed, along with 
> various modes - USB/LSB/RTTY/CW/AM/FM - AND programable wide and 
> narrow filters.  All of these settings, along with AGC, ANL and 
other 
> functions can be changed while the radio is scanning.  Not very 
> portable and rather expensive, but it is here.  I've got 2 projects 
> ahead of starting to fool around with this, but I imagine it could 
be 
> useful in finding frequencies/modes that work.  Ideas?
> Willy

> >  I have 49, and 31 meter shortwave bands, plus AM. The shortwave 
> tuning might be tricky cuz the band width is less than half the 
size 
> of the AM band, about 500 khz, so instead of tuning over a 
megahertz 
> with 8 volts, you're tuning about half that with the same tuning 
> voltage. So far I only have the local oscillators working, still 
need 
> the input RF amp for each band. The two cans close to the chip are 
IF 
> transformers, the three on the bottom edge o fthe board is the 
local 
> oscillator tank circuits.  On the highest band I'm using a red LED 
> for a varactor, it has almost the perfect capacitance value. 31m on 
> my Sony is 9400 khz to 9800 khz, and 49m is 5900 to 6200khz.  
Still, 
> how well it works, if at all, is yet to be seen.
